column4: Has anyone got any idea which SCSI driver the Intel SE7401BR2 Server Motherboard needs?
lspci should tell you how the system finds the chipset/scsi chip
I'm in the server installation. It finds none.
can you pastebin the output please?
eh, I have no output
ok so you are at the actual install screen, hmm are you installing feisty ?
try pressing ctrl+alt+f1 to get a console screen, then type lspci | more and press space to scroll down the text
I don't get a terminal.
It's... baffling to say the least
im not sure what to try next, if you have the latest desktop cd you could boot from that to try and discover the scsi information
cool! something to work on then
yeah, let me check the controller's bios
the BIOS states that AIC-7901 at slot 00 03:03:00 is found
i believe that uses the aacraid module to support that chipset, can you run lsmod to check it loaded?
my only problem is this, the "boot splash", if you will, on the scsi controller, doesn't list the device,but when I enter its bios, it is shown
I rebooted out of it :/
I'll reboot back into the desktop then?
indeed
alright, what am I looking for?
ok can you pastebin what lsmod says, as well as sudo cat /proc/partitions and sudo fdisk -l
Ergh, I have no mouse attached to the box, so I can't really use a gui
how can I dump lsmod to a file?
there we go
pastebin is being very complaining
